name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Performs structured text editing operations like find-and-replace, templating, and content transformations. It accepts a text input with specified transformation instructions and produces the modified text as output.

name: Conversational Assistance
definition: Provides general-purpose dialogue and assistance by accepting natural language inputs such as questions, instructions, or requests for explanations, and returning text responses that answer queries, provide explanations, and support multi-turn conversations.

name: Execute academic signal task
definition: This capability performs end-to-end academic signal processing by executing a complete workflow that includes data collection, interpretation, recommendation, and report generation. It accepts natural language queries that specify details such as a date and an academic topic (e.g., artificial intelligence progress, machine learning papers, deep learning developments) and produces a detailed academic report along with insights and recommendations based on the input criteria.

name: Optimized and Iteratively Refined User Prompt
definition: This capability accepts an initial user prompt as input and performs both initial optimization and subsequent iterative refinements based on feedback or additional context. It enhances clarity, focus, and contextual relevance to produce high-quality and effective prompts.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers
definition: This capability accepts inputs containing ArXiv paper IDs either as a JSON list under the key 'arxiv_ids' or embedded within natural language text. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from text when needed, retrieves detailed metadata for each paper, and applies intelligent filtering, ranking, and recommendation based on predefined semantic criteria or user instructions. The output is a JSON list of recommended ArXiv paper IDs, ordered by recommendation priority, with a maximum of 8 papers.
alias: Extract, Filter, and Recommend Papers from Text

name: Analyze and Extract ArXiv Papers
definition: This service accepts input in the form of a JSON object or natural language text containing one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs if needed, retrieves each corresponding paper from the ArXiv platform, performs in-depth content analysis and summarization, and produces a structured interpretation report in Markdown format as a JSON list.
alias: Extract and Analyze ArXiv Papers from Text

name: Download Paper PDFs with Extraction
definition: This capability accepts input either as a JSON object with an 'arxiv_ids' field or as natural language text that may include ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the text if necessary, downloads the PDF file for each corresponding paper, encodes each PDF using Base64, and returns a JSON list where each element is the Base64 encoded string of a paper's PDF.
alias: Extract IDs and Download Paper PDFs

name: Analyze Academic Literature for Research Opportunities
definition: This capability analyzes academic literature, including full research papers, text excerpts, or summaries, to extract research ideas, directions, and gaps. It accepts academic texts as input and produces a comprehensive output that includes potential research ideas, identified research gaps, and opportunities for further investigation.

name: Search Academic Papers
definition: This capability accepts both natural language and structured JSON queries to search academic papers. It queries multiple academic databases, including arXiv and Semantic Scholar, using standardized protocols and returns a JSON-formatted list of paper metadata. The metadata includes details such as title, authors, publication year, source, a (potentially truncated) abstract, and direct URLs for accessing the paper and its PDF.

name: Analyze and Review Academic Paper
definition: This service processes academic papers provided either as PDFs or accessed via URL. It downloads (if necessary), caches, and extracts text and metadata from the paper before conducting a deep content analysis and comprehensive review. The evaluation covers key academic criteria such as methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance (with ratings from 1 to 10), and the results are returned as a detailed structured Markdown report in JSON format.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: Provides information about the agent's capabilities and usage instructions. Input: a greeting or inquiry text (e.g., 'Hello', 'What can you do?'). Output: an explanation of the agent's available functions, including how to submit academic papers for review and how to use each review service effectively.

name: Assist with Text Queries
definition: This capability allows users to submit natural language text queries, questions, or statements and receive clear, concise, context-aware responses or explanations. It supports a wide range of inquiries, including Gaia tasks, by processing user input and delivering accurate and helpful text-based answers.

name: Browse the web
definition: This capability accepts user queries (e.g., 'What is the weather today?' or 'Search for information about a topic') and returns real-time information sourced from the web.
